Title: GPT4AIGChip: Towards Next-Generation AI Accelerator Design Automation via Large Language Models
Abstract: the remarkable capabilities and intricate nature of artificial intelligence  artificial intelliegence  have dramatically escalated the imperative for specialized artificial intelliegence accelerators. nonetheless designing these accelerators for various artificial intelliegence workloads remains both labor  and time intensive. while existing design exploration and automation tools can partially alleviate the need for extensive human involvement they still demand substantial hardware expertise posing a barrier to non experts and stifling artificial intelliegence accelerator development. motivated by the astonishing potential of large language models  large language model  for generating high quality content in response to human language instructions we embark on this work to examine the possibility of harnessing large language model to automate artificial intelliegence accelerator design. through this endeavor we develop gpt4aigchip a framework intended to democratize artificial intelliegence accelerator design by leveraging human natural languages instead of domain specific languages. specifically we first perform an in depth investigation into large language model' limitations and capabilities for artificial intelliegence accelerator design thus aiding our understanding of our current position and garnering insights into large language model powered automated artificial intelliegence accelerator design. furthermore drawing inspiration from the above insights we develop a framework called gpt4aigchip which features an automated demo augmented prompt generation pipeline utilizing in context learning to guide large language model towards creating high quality artificial intelliegence accelerator design. to our knowledge this work is the first to demonstrate an effective pipeline for large language model powered automated artificial intelliegence accelerator generation. accordingly we anticipate that our insights and framework can serve as a catalyst for innovations in next generation large language model powered design automation tools.
